result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Martinez-Aldea

records.addlTxt:
8:36 AM Attorney Morrow in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jevon Jones Jaconi in court for Christopher Martinez-Aldea. Interpreter, Susan Rascon, appears by ZOOM.
Court calls case.
Deft calls case.
Atty Jaconi heard - whereabouts of deft are unknown.
DA heard and requests warrant.
Court so orders.
8:38 AM
Request to appear by zoom by Atty Jaconi - ZOOM request DENIED by Judge 8-15-22
Status conference on August 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

3:06 PM Defendant Christopher Martinez-Aldea in court.  Attorney robert James mraz in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jevon Jones Jaconi not in court. 
Court calls case.
Interpreter, Susan Rascon, sworn in.
Court heard - was notified earlier today that Atty Jaconi is ill and could not appear today.
Court reschedules with parties.
Interpreter confirms date/time work with her schedule.
Interpreter to appear by ZOOM.
3:09 PM
Status conference scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Letter from Atty office: Re: rescheduling STC

10:36 AM Defendant Christopher Martinez-Aldea in court with attorney Jevon Jones Jaconi.  Robert J Mraz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Jaconi appeared by ZOOM means.  Interpreter Susan Rascon appeared by ZOOM means.
Court calls case.
Interpreter Susan Rascon sworn in.
Copy of complaint.
Atty Jaconi heard - has reviewed complaint with deft.
Deft understands charges and penalties.
Waives formal reading.
Enters not guilty plea.
Requests matter be set for a status.
10:40 off record.
10:42 back on record.
Court schedules with parties.
Interpreter confirms this date will work for her schedule.
Deft confirms that date is ok.
Court orders Atty Jaconi, Deft, and Interpreter to be present at the courthouse by 2:30, so that there is plenty of time to discuss the case before it is called at 3:30.
10:45 AM
  Status conference scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Approved with response from judge. Request to reschedule

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Christopher Martinez-Aldea
Current: 3411 Cleveland Ave, Apt 1, Marinette, WI 54143 United States  (Effective: 03-07-2022)
Prior: W4447 Eli Road, Stephenson, MI 49887

Adjourned initial appearance on March 21, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
NOH provided to Atty Jaconi, as requested by DA's office.

09:02 AM Defendant Christopher Martinez-Aldea in court.  DeShea D. Morrow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court calls case.
Atty Jaconi does not appear.
Interpreter sworn in.
Court reviews email received from Atty Jaconi on saturday with the problems of the scheduling for this matter.
Atty Jaconi is on an administrative suspension, although an email was rec'd on Sunday night, stating that he was reinstated.
DA heard - was unaware of any suspension.
9:05 am off record.
9:08 back on record.
Interpreter confirms date and time will work with his schedule.
DA heard on bond recommendations.
Court orders $1000 signature bond w/ conditions; sign waiver of extraditions, no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid Rx.
9:11 AM

  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

Payable Number: 89043,
Receipt Number: 22R 001495,
Amount: $20.00
